key_points: Russian social networks reported increased activity during Facebook's global outage.
Officials claim the outage supports Russia's efforts to develop sovereign internet platforms.
Russia has been pressuring foreign tech firms to comply with its internet regulations.
Maria Zakharova stated the outage highlights the need for Russia to have its own social networks.
Facebook's outage was due to a faulty configuration change, affecting 3.5 billion users.
Vkontakte, Russia's largest social network, saw an 18% increase in video views and a 21% increase in messages.
Vkontakte's audience increased by 19% compared to the day before the outage.
Odnoklassniki also reported increased activity during the Facebook outage.
Russia conducted tests earlier this year to disconnect from the global internet.
The move is part of Russia's effort to protect itself from being cut off from foreign internet infrastructure.
